newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH CHEMO CZK 906 MLN 96 GROSS PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: CZECH CHEMO CZK 906 MLN 96 GROSS PROFIT.

text.p: Results for calendar year 1996,
according to Czech accounting standards (in millions of
crowns):
Gross profit 906.31
Total revenues 13,444.08
Total assets 12,139.96
Note. Full company name is Chemopetrol Group a.s. .
The firm is a major Czech chemicals producer. Comparative
figures were not immediately available, but the firm said
earlier in February that it expected 1996 pre-tax profit to
fall to 1.52 billion crowns from 3.93 billion for 1995.
Total turnover fell to 16.9 billion crowns last year from
27.8 billion crowns in the final year of Chemopetrol's refinery
operations.
The fall in profit was mainly attributed to the loss in the
company's refinery operations at the end of 1995 as part of a
total restructuring and privatisation of the Czech
petrochemical industry.
In a deal completed last year, the consortium IOC, which
consists of three foreign oil groups bought a 49 percent stake
in Ceska Rafinerska, a company set up to operate the two main
refineries at Litvinov and Kralupy, which earlier belonged to
Chemopetrol and Kaucuk repsectively.
The IOC is equally owned by DuPont Co unit Conoco,
Royal Dutch Shell , and Italy's Agip . The state
holds the remaining 51 percent stake in Rafinerska through the
holding company Unipetrol a.s..
The remaining parts of Kaucuk and Chemopetrol,
both controlled by the state, are to complete a merger into
Unipetrol with a share swap planned for later this year.
-- Prague Newsroom, 42-2-2423-0003
